data.claim: Abstract-to-Digital Design Operating System: Three-layer architecture - Layer 1 (Intent): mood sentence + Kandinsky palette dial; Layer 2 (Composition): 10 principles as hierarchy toolkit + Mondrian grid discipline with intentional breaks; Layer 3 (Behavior): principles mapped to interaction/motion. DURO Runbook: 10-point checklist for every design. Critical correction: color-emotion is partially cultural (powerful heuristic, not physics law). Perceptual mechanics (scale, contrast, direction, spacing) are true constants.
data.snippet: Layer 1: Intent (mood sentence + palette) → Layer 2: Composition (hierarchy + grid + intentional discord) → Layer 3: Behavior (motion that clarifies, indicates causality, or creates mood). Rule: disorder is only allowed if it has a job. Rule: motion must clarify hierarchy, indicate causality, or create mood - if not, it's confetti.
